ygData.subject: Re: Cantera 1.5.5 and Python problem with Reservoir reactor
ygData.msgSnippet: OK.  I figured it out. Apparently, I should have from Cantera.Reactor import * before I use any reactors, reservoirs, etc. Well, you learn something new

Subject: Re: Cantera 1.5.5 and Python problem with Reservoir reactor
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=102138884

X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 08 May 2005 22:29:02 -0000

OK.  I figured it out.

Apparently, I should have "from Cantera.Reactor import *" before I
use any reactors, reservoirs, etc.

Well, you learn something new every day.

-----Mark


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "markscha" <mschaffer@s...> wrote:
> Hello.
> 
> I am using Cantera 1.5.5 with Python 2.4 on a Win XP computer, but
I 
> have not used Cantera much.
> 
> I tried to create a Reservoir "res = Reservoir(gas)" with Python, 
and 
> Python returns "NameError: name 'Reservior' is not defined"
> 
> I had "from Cantera import *" as the first line of my script.
> 
> Reservoirs seem to work with Matlab on my machine, though.
> 
> Any thoughs?
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> Mark
